pull.title: test: Fix intermittent issue in wallet_bumpfee
pull.body:
With a "dirty" mempool a transaction might fail to be accepted intermittently. For example,

* https://travis-ci.org/github/bitcoin-core/gui/jobs/719916499#L6773 Fails acceptance
* https://travis-ci.org/github/bitcoin-core/gui/jobs/719916499#L6954 Test fails

Fix the issue by clearing the mempool between subtests

verification.payload:
tree dde99a4c656139c1c9eacf39beae5948d1befbd5
parent 1d53d72948e39ad2d099a6cf2488d5652e7a1f23
author MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1598269937 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <falke.marco@gmail.com> 1598269447 +0200

test: Select at least the fee in wallet_bumpfee to avoid negative amounts

events.message: test: Select at least the fee in wallet_bumpfee to avoid negative amounts

events.message: test: Fix intermittent issue in wallet_bumpfee

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -333,6 +358,7 @@ def test_maxtxfee_fails(self, rbf_node, dest_address):
     assert_raises_rpc_error(-4, "Unable to create transaction. Fee exceeds maximum configured by -maxtxfee", rbf_node.bumpfee, rbfid)
     self.restart_node(1, self.extra_args[1])
     rbf_node.walletpassphrase(WALLET_PASSPHRASE, WALLET_PASSPHRASE_TIMEOUT)
+    self.connect_nodes(1, 0)
comments.body: I think I'd prefer to see `clear_mempool()` here, on each test end.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -333,6 +358,7 @@ def test_maxtxfee_fails(self, rbf_node, dest_address):
     assert_raises_rpc_error(-4, "Unable to create transaction. Fee exceeds maximum configured by -maxtxfee", rbf_node.bumpfee, rbfid)
     self.restart_node(1, self.extra_args[1])
     rbf_node.walletpassphrase(WALLET_PASSPHRASE, WALLET_PASSPHRASE_TIMEOUT)
+    self.connect_nodes(1, 0)

@@ -211,14 +211,15 @@ def test_notmine_bumpfee_fails(self, rbf_node, peer_node, dest_address):
     # here, the rbftx has a peer_node coin and then adds a rbf_node input
     # Note that this test depends upon the RPC code checking input ownership prior to change outputs
     # (since it can't use fundrawtransaction, it lacks a proper change output)
-    utxos = [node.listunspent()[-1] for node in (rbf_node, peer_node)]
+    fee = Decimal("0.001")
+    utxos = [node.listunspent(query_options={'minimumAmount': fee})[-1] for node in (rbf_node, peer_node)]

@@ -211,14 +211,15 @@ def test_notmine_bumpfee_fails(self, rbf_node, peer_node, dest_address):
     # here, the rbftx has a peer_node coin and then adds a rbf_node input
     # Note that this test depends upon the RPC code checking input ownership prior to change outputs
     # (since it can't use fundrawtransaction, it lacks a proper change output)
-    utxos = [node.listunspent()[-1] for node in (rbf_node, peer_node)]
+    fee = Decimal("0.001")
+    utxos = [node.listunspent(query_options={'minimumAmount': fee})[-1] for node in (rbf_node, peer_node)]
     inputs = [{
         "txid": utxo["txid"],
         "vout": utxo["vout"],
         "address": utxo["address"],
         "sequence": BIP125_SEQUENCE_NUMBER
     } for utxo in utxos]
-    output_val = sum(utxo["amount"] for utxo in utxos) - Decimal("0.001")
+    output_val = sum(utxo["amount"] for utxo in utxos) - fee
     rawtx = rbf_node.createrawtransaction(inputs, {dest_address: output_val})
comments.body:
fa347b2f2570a9436313a7c5d61015f2088662f4

nit also assert output_val > 0? `utxo` list "could" be empty.

comments.body: `createrawtransaction` asserts that the value is positive
